description: Borrowed from Italian stiletto. Doublet of stylet.

nouns.description: stiletto (plural stilettos or stilettoes or stiletti)

entries.meaning: A small, slender knife or dagger-like weapon intended for stabbing.
A woman's shoe with a tall, slender heel (called a stiletto heel).
(obsolete, historical) A beard trimmed into a pointed form. [16thâ€“17th c.]

verbs.description: stiletto (third-person singular simple present stilettos, present participle stilettoing, simple past and past participle stilettoed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To attack or kill with a stiletto (dagger).
examples: The recollection of former atrocities by the populace in plundering the city and stilettoing the inhabitants, is sufficiently fresh in the remembrance of the government to serve as an additional stimulus to prevent similar disorders.
